snippet: Experts say there is a long-term trend of shifting the cost of higher education from the public onto students and their families.
abstract: Annual report from the State Higher Education Executive Officers Association finds that state and local financing for higher education declined 7 percent in 2012, even as tuition levels have risen; points to long-term trend in which cost of higher education is shifting from the public onto students and their families.
lead_paragraph: Experts say there is a long-term trend of shifting the cost of higher education from the public onto students and their families.

headline.seo: Aid for Higher Education Declines as Costs Rise
headline.main: Financing for Colleges Declines as Costs Rise
headline.print_headline: Financing For Colleges Declines As Costs Rise
